title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 69.0 - Introduction
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 69.0 - Introduction

State Regulations

An on-premises licensee operating two or more premises
separately licensed to sell alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption, or
two or more corporate on-premises licensees which are under common control may, with the approval of the Liquor Authority, inaugurate or retain in this State
methods or practices of centralized accounting, bookkeeping, control records, billing, invoicing or payment with respect to purchases, sales or deliveries of
alcoholic beverages. For the purposes of this Part, any two or more corporate
on-premises licensees shall be deemed to be under common control if a majority
of each class of stock of each such corporation is owned by the same person. All applications for such centralized accounting and bookkeeping shall be
subject to the following terms and conditions. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
69.0

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
